p: However, even if migratory birds might be good vectors, transmission patterns indicate that circulation is partially maintained through trade of infected domestic birds [ 91, 95, 96]. For example, the long-distance expansion of H5N1 HPAI viruses in 2004 was found to be caused by human-directed movements of domestic poultry [ 96], and both LPAI and HPAI virus circulation was found to be driven by human activities in China [ 76]. Therefore, it is clear that the worldwide spread of avian IAV results from synergy between trade of infected domestic birds and wild bird movement through migratory flyways [ 91, 97].
